chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th) and Operating w/ PAC (7th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Todd A Smith was found guilty of OWI (7th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Todd A Smith was found guilty of Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to any other sentence currently serving. Credit for time served. If sentence currently being served ends up being a time served sentence, defendant may be entitled to additional 49 days credit.

superMiscConds.notes: $1,000 fine plus costs.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.

supervisions.notes: Any vehicle driven by or registered to Defendant during period of IID restriction must be equipped with Ignition Interlock Device unless otherwise ordered by the Court.

Obtain alcohol assessment through Marinette County Human Services and comply with treatment recommendations. Defendant must attend a victim impact panel either while in prison or within 6 months after being released from prison.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Todd A Smith in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Defendant Todd A Smith in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, advises of errors in PSI. State give sentencing recommendation, makes statement. Defense gives sentencing argument. Defendant makes statement, apologizes to the court.  Court makes statement, inposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.
Sentencing hearing at 03-04-2016 08:00 am

Defendant Todd A Smith in court, in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. State gives bond recommendation, makes statement. Atty Schaefer gives bond argument. Court not setting bond in this file, defendant will be held until sentencing. Court orders clerk to contact DOC to complete PSI now that defendant is in custody.
Defendant in custody.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

JA Ripp was advised by the Door County Sheriff Dept. that defendants sentence in Oconto Co. will be completed on 12/21/15. Defendant's Door Co. cases will be scheduled for sentencing hearings when he is returned to Door Co. on the warrant.
from Atty Reetz indicating defendant is ready to proceed to sentencing without a PSI if it pleases the Court and the State.  OK per DTE.
from Atty Reetz asking he's been appointed by SPD to represent defendant.

State's Motion for judgment on bond forfeiture. Court approve motion. Jury fee in the amount of $1,367.79 and interpreter fee in the amount of $90 will be paid out of the bond. Remaining amount will be forfeited.

of Bail/Bond Forfeiture
Per Judge Ehlers, send out 30 day notice of bond forfeiture. Have DA's office re-calendar for 30 days out to do judgment of bond forfeiture. DTE
from Shawano County DA requesting certified copy of bond.

Attorney Eric Paul Pitsch in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, reviews motions from Atty Pitsch to quash warrant and withdraw plea. Atty Pitsch indicates defendant was advised of todays hearing as late as last night. Atty Pitsch indicates he's put considerable time into this case, defendant won't listen to him, doesn't keep in contact with him, doesn't show up for court proceedings, hasn't paid  him. Atty Pitsch moves to withdraw his motions, moves to withdraw from the case. State has no objection to Atty Pitsch withdrawing. Court grants Atty Pitsch's oral motion to withdraw from the case. Bench warrant stands.
to Quash Warrant (Defense motion)

from DOC Agent Antonio Cummings advising it is not possible to complte the PSI as defendant has not reported to the jail as ordered by the court. No further action by DOC needed. DTE

from Atty Pitsch requesting a hearing to quash warrant. Court sets hearing.
to Forfeit Bond. Court will deal with motion to forfeit cash bond at sentencing hearing. DTE
to Produce Chromatography Information
Defense Motion to Produce Chromatography Information
Motion, Stipulation and Order for Substitution of Counsel. Atty Eric Pitsch substituted for Atty Greg Gerbers.
Defendant found guilty of OWI 7th - to be held in custody until sentencing date.

Defendant Todd A Smith appears by phone along with attorney Eric Pitsch who appears in person.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation Agent Antonio Cummings and DOC Supervisor Mary Kay Tallier also present in court. Court reviews events in file.  State concerned that defendant is not cooperating with DOC regarding PSI they are to prepare. Atty Pitsch just came on the case and needs time to investigate whether defendant will be filing a motion to withdraw his plea. Court questions why defendant is not in court in person. Atty Pitsch advises defendant is out of state working and with short notice of todays hearing, he wasn't able to be here. Court questions defendant on whether he's had back surgery. Defendant indicates surgery is scheduled for Monday. Court makes statement, defendant has not kept court advised of current address, employer and he's out on a medical furlough for an OWI 7th. Court not happy with situation. Court orders defendant to report to the Door County Jail by 2:00 pm today. If he doesn't report by 2:00 pm, court will be signing a warrant for his arrest and when taken into custody, defendant will be held until his sentencing date. If defendant decides to cooperate with DOC regarding the PSI and Agent Cummings doesn't feel he can have the PSI done by 4/17/15, Agent Cummings to send letter to court and court will deal with issue then.
from Atty Pitsch's office requesting phone appearance for Mr. Smith. Court responds - No - defendant needs to be in court in person. DTE

from Atty Pitsch's office asking to reschedule 3/25/15 status conference and 4/17/15 sentencing hearing as he's just been retained to represent defendant. Court responds, No - 3/25/15 hearing is on. DTE
from Atty Gerbers regarding defendants compliance with PSI by DOC.
from ADA Korb regarding attempts DOC has made in contacting defendant regarding the PSI they are to prepare.
from ADA Korb requesting a reviews of defendant's furlough status. Court sets status for 3/25/15. Defendant needs to be in court in person. DTE
from ADA Korb requesting a bench warrant or set the matter for a hearing to order defendant to comply with PSI/Compass evaluation

records.addlTxt: Defendant Todd A Smith in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Cts. 1 & 3. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 1 & 3. Court dismisses Cts. 2 & 4 but reads in for sentencing. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin. State offers Exh. 1 - certified copy of defendants driving record. Court receives exhibit.  State/Defense requesting a PSI. Court orders PSI. Defense requests furlough, to begin immediately, so defendant can obtain medical treatment for an ongoing issue. Discussion regarding furlough. State feels defendant needs to provide some definitive medical documentation before a furlough should be granted. Court indicates defendant will be taken into custody today, then grants a medical furlough to begin immediately. Defendant needs to return on 2/23/15 at 2:30 pm with medical documention. Bond remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 02:15 pm.
Defendant's Motion to Adjourn Trial Date

Attorney Gregory A. Gerbers appears by phone.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court addresses Defendant's motion to adjourn trial. State feels it's a little late at this point, defendant was aware of these phone calls. Atty Gerbers indicates he wasn't aware of these phone calls until Friday.  State asks court to deny motion. Court makes statement, denies motion for adjournment. Trial will proceed as scheduled.

Defendant Todd A Smith appears by phone along with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers who appears in person.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file.  Atty Gerbers indicates defendant is having some medical issues, may be requesting an adjournment of the trial, will know more information tomorrow. Court indicates this matter has been pending since June, needs to move forward. Bond remains in effect.
Leanne Helmrich is available to interpret at jury trial for witness Josh Lavine the afternoon of 2/18/15.
Pre-trial conference on February 2, 2015 at 08:45 am.
Jury trial on February 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
from PD office requesting phone appearance for defendant at 10/27/14 hearing. Court grants request.

Defendant Todd A Smith appears by phone along with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers, who appears in person.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerbers asks court to set matter for pretrial and trial. Court questions counsel on how many days to set aside for trial. Court will set trial for 2 days. Bond remains in effect.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Bond remains as is.
State's Discovery Demand

Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Status conference scheduled for October 27, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Waiver of Prelim on September 2, 2014 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 27, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limit for prelim. Set for prelim. Bond remains in effect.

State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 23, 2014 at 10:00 am.
